fields_of_interest: Energy, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action
head_office_address: HR Wallingford Ltd Howbery Business Park
eu_initiatives:
HR Wallingford is a private, not for profit research and consultancy company within the 
environmental water sector. We participate in research including European research and have a 
long track record through Framework Programmes 5, 6, 7 and Horizon 2020 including leading 
and participating in large consortium projects. We also contribute to EMODnet by leading and 
participating in projects seeking to improve the use of marine data across Europe.
membership:
BPA (British Ports Association) 
CEDA (Central Dredging Association) 
CIRIA (Construction Industry Research and Information Association) 
IAHR (International Association of Hydro-Environment Engineering and Research) 
SMI (Society of Maritime Industries)
goals__remit:
HR Wallingford works with a range of clients in the water sector to complete research and 
consultancy for policy makers, regional planners, the European Commission, water companies 
and developers. Our research enables us to help clients solve water management problems. 
We work with clients to promote good water governance, provide reliable water resources for 
industrial, municipal and agricultural needs, improve water quality and enhance the 
environment. 
We provide expert advice on water related problems in various sectors, including flooding, 
coasts, maritime, energy and environment. This enables effective development, engineering and 
policy making in these areas.
relevant_communication:
Registration on this register has been prompted by the opportunity to join the EMODnet 
Informal Expert Group on Marine Knowledge. Further information included in this form will relate 
to that particular activity.
position: Research Director and Chief Technical Director (Maritime)
